abstract.text: A list template row that displays a series of images.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to display a series of images as a row in a list template. At runtime, use

to determine the maximum number of images that the row displays. CarPlay may display fewer images, depending on the width of the vehicle’s primary screen. Provide images that are display-ready, and include light and dark variants of each. See
to the list item that CarPlay executes when the user selects the item. You can assign a second handler,
, which CarPlay calls when the user selects an individual image.
CarPlay doesn’t support custom list item types. Instead, use the
property to attach a value to the list item that provides additional context, such as specifying  a model object that corresponds to the item.

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
A list template row that displays a series of images.
The images that appear in the list item’s image row.
An optional closure that CarPlay invokes when the user selects the list item.
Update the titles displayed each image in this image row item. If this image row
item is already displayed in a list template, then it will be automatically
reloaded.
Creates a list item that displays a row of images.
Creates a list item that displays a row of images with a title below each image.
A Boolean value that indicates if the item is enabled.
An optional closure that CarPlay invokes when the user selects an image.
The maximum size of an image that an image row can display.
The list item’s primary text.
Adds, removes, reorders, or updates the images in the list item’s image row.
An opaque value for the list item.
A selectable row in a list template.
Creates a section with list items, a header, a section index title, and section header details.
Creates a section with list items.
Creates a section with list items, a header, and a section index title.
A description of the common properties of all list item types.
The maximum number of images that an image row can contain.
A list template row that represents a conversation or contact.
A description of a selectable list item.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
